discussion.content: This is SWOT (Strength, Weaknesses, Opportunities, and Threats)

KPP (Key Performance Parameters) are measures of the performance or effectiveness of a product or system. They are used to determine how well a product or system meets the requirements or expectations of the customer or user. In the context of a project, the KPPs can be used to identify the defect tolerance of the project, or the level of defects that are acceptable in the final product or deliverable. The KPPs can be defined in the project scope statement or other project documents, and can be used to help the team understand the quality standards that they are expected to meet.

questions.question_text:
A testing event was held and deemed unsuccessful. After review, it becomes clear that the two project teams had different expectations of the testing.
Which of the following is needed between the two teams?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Communication plan

If the two project teams had different expectations of the testing event, it suggests that there may have been a lack of effective communication between the teams. A communication plan can help to ensure that all team members have a clear understanding of the project goals and objectives, and can help to prevent misunderstandings or miscommunications. A communication plan should outline how information will be shared between the teams, who is responsible for communicating what, and how often communication will take place. It can also include guidelines for how team members should communicate with each other and with stakeholders, and can help to ensure that everyone is on the same page.
